item.title: Kristen Stewart’s Directorial Debut ‘The Chronology of Water’ to Close Oldenburg
item.description: Stewart’s first feature as a director premiered in Un Certain Regard in Cannes and was picked up for North America by The Forge.

item.title: ‘Eugene the Marine’ With Scott Glenn to Open Oldenburg Film Festival
item.description: The German indie festival will pay tribute to the legendary 86-year-old character actor with a career retrospective.

item.title: Oldenburg Unveils First Wave of Premieres for 32nd Edition

item.title: Oldenburg Fest to Honor ‘Critters’ Star Don Keith Opper
item.description: The German independent festival will screen a retrospective of Opper’s work, including the first two ‘Critters’ movies as well as ‘Android’ and ‘Slam Dance.’

item.title: Oldenburg Fest to Honor ‘Critters’ Star Don Keith Opper
item.description: The German independent festival will screen a retrospective of Opper’s work, including the first two ‘Critters’ movies as well as ‘Android’ and ‘Slam Dance.’

item.title: Oldenburg Fest to Honor Music Producer and ‘Electra Glide in Blue’ Director James William Guercio
item.description: Best known as a music producer for bands including Chicago, the Beach Boys, and Blood, Sweat & Tears, Guercio directed his one cult film in 1973.
